alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 2:49AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Deaf Smith County through 330 AM CDT... At 248 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Hereford, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hereford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
